meta.title: TSC COVID-19 - Tippecanoe School Corporation

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasTwoColumnBottomLayout fsSection2687 fsHasTheme2 district

div.p: The information provided on this webpage is intended to update the TSC community on our response plan to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). The situation is rapidly-evolving and updates change daily as new information becomes available. We strongly encourage parents/guardians to download the TSC2Go mobile app and to verify their contact information is correct in the Powerschool Parent Portal, as updates and urgent information related to TSC's response to the COVID-19 pandemic will be sent via email and posted to the TSC website.

Governor Eric Holcomb announced that all Indiana schools will remain closed and will continue remote learning for the remainder of the school year to help prevent the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19). This includes the TSC's playgrounds and ball fields.
The TSC will utilize remote student learning resources on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday through May 15, the last day of the school year.

Tippecanoe School Corporation Superintendent Dr. Scott Hanback has provided ongoing communication to patrons about the COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on the TSC through email messages and news posts on the TSC website. Click the link below to view past communications.

The Tippecanoe School Corporation places high priority on the quality of instruction we provide to all of our students and the manner in which it's delivered. In extenuating circumstances such as the COVID-19 pandemic, remote learning may be utilized as a method for providing instruction when face-to-face interaction isn't possible.

Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a respiratory illness that can spread from person to person. The virus that causes COVID-19 is thought to spread mainly between people who are in close contact with one another (within about six feet) through respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes.

The TSC Nutrition Services Department will begin providing grab-and-go lunches on Mondays at three locations in Tippecanoe County. The meals will be available at no cost to all TSC students in kindergarten through high school. The lunch bags will contain a sandwich, fruit, vegetable and milk for five days and will be served on a first come, first serve basis.

During this time of COVID-19, it is especially important to take care of our mental health and know the resources available to us. Please follow this link to find resources for TSC parents and families, caring for our mental health during times of uncertainty, talking with our children about COVID-19 and links to community and mental health services.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window
